subject: AI
title: Cost Optimization
description: Keeping AI workflow costs under control at scale.

hook.text: Your workflow processes 10,000 documents per day. Each passes through 3 AI steps using GPT-4. Monthly cost: $15,000. Can you get the same quality for less?

buildup.text: Cost levers: (1) Model tiering ‚Äî use GPT-3.5 for classification, GPT-4 for generation. (2) Caching ‚Äî same inputs get same outputs, skip the API call. (3) Batching ‚Äî process multiple items per API call.

discovery.text: The biggest win is usually model tiering: classification with a small model costs 1/10th of GPT-4 and often has the same accuracy. Reserve expensive models for the steps that need them.

twist.text: Caching AI responses needs care: if the model generates slightly different outputs each time (temperature > 0), caching might return stale or irrelevant cached responses. Cache classification steps (deterministic) more aggressively than generation steps.

climax.text: Track cost per workflow run, not just total monthly spend. If a workflow costs $0.15 per run and processes 10,000 items, that's $1,500/month. Optimize the most expensive step first.

punchline.text: Cheap models for easy steps. Expensive models for hard steps. Cache what you can. That's the playbook.

quiz.question: What is typically the most effective cost optimization for AI workflows?
options: Using the most expensive model for every step
Model tiering ‚Äî using cheaper models for simpler steps like classification
